skill.name: monty-code-review
skill.description: Hyper-pedantic code review skill that emulates Monty's Django4Lyfe backend engineering philosophy and review style. Use this when reviewing or refactoring Python/Django code in this backend repo and you want a strict, correctness-first, multi-tenant-safe, deeply nitpicky review.
skill.summary: Hyper-pedantic code review skill that emulates Monty's Django4Lyfe backend engineering philosophy an...
skill.author: DiversioTeam

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and review guidelines. No executable code, no file system access beyond reading its own files, no network calls, and no external commands. This is a safe, documentation-only skill for providing code review instructions to AI agents.

content.user_title: Review Django code with strict, correctness-first standards
content.value_statement: Review Python and Django code with hyper-pedantic standards focused on correctness, multi-tenant safety, and SOLID principles. Get detailed, actionable feedback written to a Markdown file in your repository.
actual_capabilities: Perform pedantic Django code reviews with severity tags (BLOCKING, SHOULD_FIX, NIT)
Check for multi-tenant boundary violations and data integrity issues
Review SOLID principle compliance with specific examples and anti-patterns
Validate migration safety and schema change best practices
Enforce test coverage requirements for new behavior
Write structured reviews to Markdown files in the repository
limitations: Only provides review guidance - does not auto-fix code
Focused on specific codebase conventions (Optimo, survey apps)
Requires AI agent to access and read code files

use_cases.title: Django PR Reviews
use_cases.description: Get detailed, correctness-focused reviews for Django pull requests with specific improvement suggestions.

use_cases.title: Code Quality Standards
use_cases.description: Enforce consistent code quality standards across the team with structured review criteria.

use_cases.title: Migration Safety Checks
use_cases.description: Review Django migrations for downtime-safety, large table schema changes, and data integrity.

prompt_templates.title: Full Pedantic Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use your monty-code-review skill to review this Django PR like Monty would, and be fully pedantic with your usual severity tags.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Review
prompt_templates.scenario: Light review with only blocking issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this Django PR like Monty would, but only flag blocking or should-fix issues; skip the tiny nits.

prompt_templates.title: Migration Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review these Django migrations for downtime-safety, large table changes, and data integrity issues.

prompt_templates.title: SOLID Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check this code for SOLID principle violations and suggest refactoring patterns where appropriate.

output_examples.input: Use monty-code-review to review this Django PR
output: VERDICT: Request changes due to blocking multi-tenant and test coverage issues
What's great: Nice use of transaction.atomic around export generation
BLOCKING: Queryset missing organization scoping - risks cross-tenant leakage
SHOULD_FIX: Potential N+1 when iterating over responses - consider prefetching

best_practices: Provide the PR description or ticket context for more targeted reviews
Specify if you want a full pedantic review or a quick pass focusing on blocking issues
Include relevant ticket numbers or design docs in your request
Review the generated Markdown file and address all blocking issues before merging
anti_patterns: Skipping reviews for 'small' changes - correctness issues can hide in any PR
Ignoring multi-tenant boundary violations even if tests pass
Adding migrations that modify large tables without proper backfill strategy
Merging without addressing SHOULD_FIX items - they compound over time

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude Code, OpenAI Codex, and standard Claude. Install via plugin or skill installer.

faq.question: What codebases work best?
faq.answer: Designed for Django/Python backends with multi-tenant data, time dimensions, and survey-related features.

faq.question: Does it auto-fix issues?
faq.answer: No. It provides detailed, actionable feedback written to a Markdown file. You apply fixes manually.

faq.question: Is my code safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill. It only reads files you request and writes review summaries to Markdown.

faq.question: How strict is the review?
faq.answer: Default is fully pedantic. Request a lighter pass to only flag blocking and should-fix issues.

faq.question: Can I customize the standards?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill allows specifying lighter reviews or focusing on specific areas like migrations or SOLID compliance.
